ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Are you able to do chores such as vacuuming or yard work?
Notes: 1=Unable to do; 2=With much difficulty; 3=With some difficulty; 4=With a little difficulty; 5=Without any difficulty; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace?
Notes: 1=Unable to do; 2=With much difficulty; 3=With some difficulty; 4=With a little difficulty; 5=Without any difficulty; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: Are you able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes?
Notes: 1=Unable to do; 2=With much difficulty; 3=With some difficulty; 4=With a little difficulty; 5=Without any difficulty; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: Are you able to run errands and shop?
Notes: 1=Unable to do; 2=With much difficulty; 3=With some difficulty; 4=With a little difficulty; 5=Without any difficulty; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 5): Does your health limit you in doing two hours of physical labor?
Notes: 1 = Cannot do; 2 = Quite a lot; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Very little; 5 = Not at all; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 6): Does your health now limit you in doing moderate work around the house?
Notes: 1 = Cannot do; 2 = Quite a lot; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Very little; 5 = Not at all; -999 = Missing
